title: Windows FontSubstitutes not working on Firefox 89 (for available fonts)
content:
Windows has a registry folder called FontSubstitutes where you can define substitutes for various fonts. For example, there's built-in rules to replace Helvetica and Helvetica Neue with Arial as neither of the former is installed on Windows.

I had added a few rules of my own to swap fonts like Segoe UI and Arial (with the pleasant Inter), and Firefox would honor these rules until v88. The "replaced" fonts would entirely disappear from web pages and even the browser chrome.

This is no longer the case on v89 with the big design refresh. Note that Segoe UI and Arial are both available in Windows, however Firefox 88 and below would bypass that and use the FontSubstitutes value instead (as it should, in my opinion). Unfortunately, v89 completely ignores FontSubstitutes if the fonts are available. This is similar to what the Chromium browsers (and many other apps) do, and it's honestly very annoying.

If there's an about:config or something else to revert this behavior, that would be great. TIA!

Screenshots attached for Firefox 89 and Firefox 78.11.0 ESR.

title: Tabs on Bottom Release 89.0
content:
Hello, all.

This is not a question but a pointer for those who have successfully been using userChrome.css to put the tabs where they belong, below the Bookmarks bar. :-)

If you used a userChrome.css solution such as that presented in threads like the support article "tabs on bottom release 72.0.1" (full disclosure, that is my solution), then you just need to add to the #TabsToolbar section one line:

top: var(--uc-titlebar-padding,86px);

You can play with the "86px" until you have the tabs where you like them. Depending upon my profile and other CSS options, I have to move that a few pixels up or down to get it looking just right.

title: Pasting images in some applications/sites results in weird colored boxes
content:
For the past month, whenever I try to paste images into certain sites (Whatsapp Web for example), I get these weird distorted colored boxes instead (example attached). Some details:

  • It doesn't happen everywhere - it happens on Whatsapp Web, but it doesn't happen on Google Hangouts/Chat or Tumblr
  • It doesn't happen on Whatsapp Web on Chrome, which is why I was thinking it's a Firefox issue and not necessarily a Whatsapp issue
  • It happens with any copied image, whether it's an existing image that I've copied or a screenshot that I've taken with something like Greenshot
  • I can copy an image, and then if I were to hit paste once, the weird colored box might be green, and if I were to hit paste again, the weird colored box might be purple, and if I did it again, the box might be red. I don't have any idea what that means, but basically it seems like whatever distortion is going on has nothing to do with the underlying copied image.

Things I have tried:

  • I tried disabling my extensions - that didn't do anything
  • I tried removing them one by one - that didn't do anything
  • I did a full refresh of Firefox - that temporarily fixed the problem - yay! And then some extensions reinstalled themselves automatically and the problem came back. So I did that a couple more times to replicate, and yes, if I do a refresh, I can make the colored box problem go away until whatever is happening where these extensions reinstall themselves. I've tried completely removing them and restarting my computer, and that doesn't make the colored box problem go away. I tried renaming the Firefox folder in Program Files and reinstalling Firefox and I still ended up with all of my bookmarks and settings and extensions, so that didn't help.

I'm open to any suggestions. Right now I'm thinking it might not even be an extension issue, but some other setting that's getting imported at the same time as these extensions are reinstalling themselves, which is why it doesn't help that I disable/remove them. I don't think I've tinkered much with the Firefox settings since I started using it, and I definitely can't think of anything I did a month ago, but if anyone can think of anything that could cause something like this, I'll try anything! Thanks!

title: Új külső az asztali böngésző legújabb frissítésével.
content: Tisztelt Firefox fejlesztők! Talán már több mint másfél évtizede használom a Mozilla termékeit, több platformon/operációs rendszeren (jelenleg win10). Ez a frissítés egy hatalmas csalódás, tekintettel arra, hogy ez az új design, illetve struktúrája a felhasználói felületnek (lapfülek elhelyezkedése, stb.) nem képezi integráns részét az operációs rendszerek felhasználói felületének. Nem tudom ki volt az a munkájához (ergonomia, felhasználhatóság) nem értő, aki ezt engedélyezte. Hogy juthat valakinek eszébe, egy olyan böngészőt ráerőltetni a felhasználókra, ami teljesen más logika alapján kezeli a lapokat, menüket funkciókat elrendezését tekintve, mint az az operációs rendszer amin használják. Lehet hogy a GTK környezetben linuxon ez még nagyjából elmegy, de windowson egy agyrém. miért kell szívatni a felhasználót? miért kell egy a rendszerbe nem illeszkedő designt néznem egész nap? Igen irritáló. Mi ez a szar? Ez egy böngésző, munkaeszköz, stb nem egy idióta játék, amit tökmindegy milyenre faragnak, mert úgy is csak játék és legtöbbször fullscreenben futtatják. Nekem olyan böngészőre lenne szükségem, ami integráns külsőt, és funkció/menü rendszert képez azzal a környezettel, ami a GUI-t jellemzi az adott operációs rendszeren, hogy az egységesítés hatékonyabbá tegye az életet. Hatalmas csalódást okoztak. Ez így használhatatlan szar (nem tudok finomabban fogalmazni, mert sokkal durvábbra gondolok mint amit ide írtam) valószínűleg az alapítványnál pár embernek más munka után kéne néznie. Kérdésem, hogy hogyan lehetne visszaváltani a régi felhasználói felületre, ami egységes egészet képezett a windowséval.
